edu.cscc.javaadventure

Class TreasureChest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cscc.javaadventure.JAObject
      • edu.cscc.javaadventure.TreasureChest

  • public class TreasureChest
extends JAObject
    Represents a treasure chest in a role-playing game. The treasure chest can be locked or unlocked, and open or unopened. A locked chest must be unlocked before it can be opened. Locking a chest also closes it. A treasure chest also has a weight and a description. The description is different depending on if the chest is locked or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreasureChest

        public TreasureChest()
        Constructs a TreasureChest. A treasure chest has a default weight and is locked and closed by default.

    • Method Detail

      • setupDescriptionModifiers

        public void setupDescriptionModifiers()
        See JAObject.setupDescriptionModifiers().
        Specified by:
        setupDescriptionModifiers in class JAObject

      • getWeight

        public java.lang.Double getWeight()
        Returns the weight of the treasure chest.
        Overrides:
        getWeight in class JAObject
        Returns:
        The weight of the treasure chest to a precision of two decimal places.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Indicates if the treasure chest is open or not.
        Returns:
        true if it is open (which also implies it is unlocked), false otherwise.

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Indicates if the treasure chest is locked or not.
        Returns:
        true if the chest is locked, false otherwise.

      • lock

        public void lock()
          throws ChestLockedException
        Locks the chest. It also closes the chest if it was open.
        Throws:
        ChestLockedException - if the chest is already locked.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Unlocks the chest. Note, this method does *not* open the chest.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws ChestAlreadyOpenException,
                 ChestLockedException
        Opens the chest. A chest must be unlocked before it can be opened.
        Throws:
        ChestAlreadyOpenException - if the chest is already open.
        ChestLockedException - if the chest is locked.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the chest. Notes: This method does *not* also lock the chest.

      • addObject

        public boolean addObject(JAObject object)

      • getContents

        public java.util.List<JAObject> getContents()

      • removeObject

        public JAObject removeObject(java.lang.String name)
